info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 6 at 8:53AM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
Trinity River at Riverside affecting San Jacinto, Polk, Walker and Trinity Counties.
For the Trinity River...including Riverside...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Trinity River at Riverside.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 134.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues with the boat ramp in the Deep River Plantation Subdivision in Walker County inundated. Backwater flooding up Thomas Lake in Walker County floods the boat ramp in the Green Rich Shores Subdivision in Walker County. At 135.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues as significant backwater up Thomas Lake floods the lowest areas in the Green Rich Shore Subdivision in Walker County with the boat ramp completely inundated. The lowest lying areas in the Deep River Plantation Subdivision and FM 980 northwest of Riverside are threatened.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 133.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 133.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM CDT Tuesday was 133.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 134.6 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 133.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 134.6 feet on 05/15/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/hgx.
The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 300 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Polk, TX; San Jacinto, TX; Trinity, TX; Walker, TX
